FuncDef: The display service activate-fail-record command displays the record about failures to activate a service.
CLIs: display service activate-fail-record [ bod | daa | edsg ] [ time <begin-time> <end-time> [ date <begin-date> <end-date> ] | user-id <user-id> | policy-name <policy-name> ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Specify the time that the device began to record the information.
The format is hh:mm:ss, where hh ranges from 0 to 23 and mm ranges from 0 to 59.

Specify the time that the device stopped to record the information.
The format is hh:mm:ss, where hh ranges from 0 to 23 and mm ranges from 0 to 59.

Specify the date that the device began to record the information.
The format is YYYY/MM/DD, standing for year/month/day.

Specify the date that the device stopped to record the information.
The format is YYYY/MM/DD, standing for year/month/day.

Specify the User ID.
The value is an integer and it ranges from 0 to 3145727.

Specifies the name of the service policy.
The value is a string and it ranges from 1 to 200 characters.

Examples: Activate fail reason : Service authentication reject
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command can display the record about failures to activate a service. Usually it is used as a troubleshooting method. When a service is deactivated, you can use this command to check the record and get the information about when the service started and the reason why it failed to be activated.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
